intro: Hieracium oinopolepis, commonly known as the Greek hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in open, sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium oinopolepis is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
